description: Gay fashion designer Kamlesh, still reeling from a recently-ended relationship, invites a group of friends for dinner for a special announcement. However, the situation worsens when Kamlesh's sister arrives with her new fiancé, a ...
keywords: two word title,coming out party,lgbt,lgbt interest,gay kiss
name: Mango Souffle

review.name: Love in India
review.reviewBody: Mango Soufflé. Based on the play "On a Muggy Night in Mumbai". stars Ankur Vikal. weaving of the LGBT story with the arranged marriage story, at least the first half of the film. Some cute lines in here, and i really liked the circle of friends that gets back together. but they needed to fine tune the script a bit, and SO many long pauses. it kind of slows the story down a little. It's India, so mom and dad have arranged the marriage, but the groom's (Ed, played by Atul Kulkarni) secret will come out before the film is over. The LGBT group is fun, funny, and barely functional, but of course that will clash with the family's plan. If you have the patience, the second half picks up a bit, but as my grandmother would say, "The story goes all around the mulberry bush." Written and directed by Mahesh Dattani; his first film project. Pretty good once it gets going. takes a while to get into the swing. Currently playing on FilmRise channel.
